intro: Krynitzkia fulvocanescens var. idahoensis, commonly known as the Idaho sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces fruit that consists of a capsule containing numerous small seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations to its habitat.
